basics.name: Nick Silverman
basics.label: Production Engineer
basics.summary: Expert in design and implementation of scalable cloud-native platforms, services, and infrastructure that solve for complex business needs. Extensive experience in creating modern DevOps standards for all facets of the development and operational life cycles that drive accelerated innovation and increased reliability/sustainability. Robust background in AWS core services, and networking technologies with an infrastructure as code first approach. Accomplished lead building strong, highly skilled, and autonomous teams.

highlights: Led a team of high performing cloud infrastructure engineers responsible for both maintaining multiple cloud environments and designing/implementing cross-functional projects aligning with business goals
Championed replacement of our primary CDN which resulted in a drastic improvement in development speed and efficiency, and a nearly $300,000 annual cost reduction
Organized tech-wide replacement of a legacy job scheduling system, bringing mission critical asynchronous tasks into the cloud-native world and improving resiliency, reliability, and repeatability

work.summary: Principal individual responsible for working with development teams across the technology organization to design complex systems architectures cloud infrastructure. Creating operational standards and best practices to multiply the capabilities of all team members. Leading major technology initiatives to drive the future success of the business.
highlights: Led multi-year, multi-department project to decommission legacy Active Directory domain used throughout the company
Created, socialized, and built business standards and infrastructure for scalable, resilient container infrastructure and orchestration for all current and future production systems
Designed and implemented multi-region, multi-account, and hybrid networking solution for cross environment and office network connectivity on AWS including secure third-party partner access
Contributed to AWS open-source codebases and authored public blog posts on AWS official blog
Developed container runtime for legacy .net applications, leading in the modernization of their infrastructure in collaboration with the development teams
Created training curriculum and instructed teams on cloud-native architectures and best practices
Managed AWS and cloud costs, building clear tagging and reporting standards for all resources. Calculated and executed on enterprise savings and discount plans with AWS
Designed and developed real time production uptime monitoring and reporting system, providing high level, single pane of glass views for business stakeholders

work.summary: Experienced cloud infrastructure engineer driving standards and best practices in modern AWS environments. Developed automation tooling to accelerate platform maturity and increased cloud-native usage.
highlights: Re-platformed multiple services to scalable, resilient containerized architectures
Developed and implemented standards for complex, modularized, and repeatable Infrastructure as code via terraform used across technology organization
Led integration and redesign of cloud infrastructure from a business acquisition

work.summary: Department leader, mentor, and primary point of contact for DevOps across the business. Led the team in architecture and complex systems development. Regular contact with executive level leadership to steer future of tech from the DevOps lens.
highlights: Spearheaded re-platforming of acquired business to standardize operations and increase integration with core technologies
Oversaw DevOps team responsible for AWS deployments and maintenance, and site reliability efforts
Designed and developed a streamlined tracking process for provisioning new customer environments
Owned and managed operational budgets across all DevOps vendors including AWS, Atlassian, Fastly, etc.
Collaborated across tech teams to support and improve systems supporting CI/CD and customer environments

work.summary: Team lead who oversaw and organized major platform changes and projects. Designed tooling for further internal automation.
highlights: Unified Puppet codebase so all platforms are configured and operate uniformly.
Authored and deployed internal Ruby web services for employee use and platform automation and monitoring.
Designed and organized architecture for all new platform features in collaboration with engineering teams.
Coordinated platform-wide improvements and planned maintenance with the organization and customers.
Created systems for improved internal platform stability and performance.
Built out the platform into new global regions in an effort to expand to global markets.
Developed and managed AWS and vendor business and technical relationships.

work.summary: Primary developer and maintainer of the production platforms. Designed and implemented a re-architecture of the platform infrastructure. Responsible for 24/7 NOC and SLA level support.
highlights: Designed and implemented a multi-tenant architecture for the production platform that is cost efficient and scalable for any size customer.
Migrated legacy platform from on-prem solution to full-cloud solution.
Improved platform stability with near real-time monitoring solution and automated service-level management.
Designed multi-region DR remediation plans and processes to ensure fault tolerance.
Automated new tenant creation and created CI/CD for the product.
Maintained custom web-server and other application binaries, optimized for the production platform.
Converted infrastructure to Terraform code and designed drop-in modules for all future infrastructure.
Crafted incident response workflow and process for multi-tier support.

work.summary: Learned the platform architecture to grow into an individual contributor. Maintained the operation of the legacy platform and assisted in the implementation of a new platform for enterprise customers.
highlights: Implemented corporate Windows infrastructure via Active Directory and migrated from Open Directory.
Authored monitoring scripts for various aspects of the platform.
Designed and implemented automated external monitoring solution for internal and external customers.
Deployed new production platforms for on-boarding clients.

work.summary: Provided Level Two support for all hardware and software. Managed multiple inventory and package management systems. Built and configured multiple Linux servers for internal support tools using Puppet.
First line of technical support for all HBG employees. Supported Microsoft Office, Adobe CS Suite, and many other internal systems and applications on Mac and PC.
Sales leader in all metrics of the store. Provided technical and sales support for more advanced customers and specialists. Trained and mentored specialists and led store meetings.
Sales and support for all customers of the Apple Retail Store. Performed basic troubleshooting of iOS and Mac issues.
Provided phone support for iOS devices, iTunes, and Apple ID. Certified on iOS device hardware and software.
Technical Engineer for TEDx LitchfieldED conference. Audio/Visual support for 2012 Connecticut Student Innovation Expo. Maintained mobile iPod touch and MacBook labs.
Hardware, software, and peripheral support throughout campus, Mac and PC. Managed Cisco switches and other network devices.

volunteer.summary: Managed the digital library of music and media for the station. Organized purchase and distribution of digital content.
